Key Match Events: James Rodríguez scored one goal and set up two more as Colombia thoroughly dismantled Panama in a 5-0 win.
Luis Díaz scored in the 41st minute.
Miguel Borja scored a penalty in the 90+4' minute.
Jhon Córdoba scored in the 8th minute.
Richard Ríos scored in the 70th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Herculez Gomez: James Rodriguez is the best player in the tournament
Post-Match Reflections: Colombia into Copa SF as Diaz, James lead rout
Miscellaneous Highlights: Colombia marched into the Copa América semifinals with a 5-0 win.
The match was played at the State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Arizona, with an attendance of 39,740.
Others: James Rodríguez was instrumental in Colombia's victory, scoring one goal and setting up two more.
